Does not respond aggressively or escalate Frank's threats/enforcement of debt, remains somewhat passive.
Refuses to put blame on others despite pressure ('Don’t put this on me.'), suggesting some personal accountability.
Stares silently at the bar when confronted, showing withdrawal or emotional distance.
Acknowledges watching others do things is passive but concedes reading is active; shows some self-awareness.
Stares silently at the bar instead of engaging with the urgent problem or suggesting solutions.
Reliable knowledge of his grandfather’s boat and its history, showing knowledge of assets.
Fails to demonstrate any proactive or confident response to threat and debt situation.
Uses the car key and checks the trunk, pulls out cell phone to make a direct call giving clear instructions, avoids texting for security, shows intentional preparation for a job.
Comes to consciousness on the floor after being attacked, tries to deny having money and being involved, but is physically overwhelmed and forced into submission.
Attempts to maintain composure and deny responsibility while confronted by Mister Lee despite physical threat and pain.
Watches the game uncertainly, showing distress and panic as events unfold.
Observes the game carefully and notices key details about players' performance and game flow.
Leaves the arena during a critical moment of the game, seemingly disengaged from the unfolding event.
Remains attentive enough to answer his ringing cell phone promptly and conduct a brief, relevant conversation about Vegas.
Refuses to accept a bribe or unethical offer (rejects 'keep your job' offer, says 'I'd tell you to kill me').
Does not tip anyone despite having money.
Shows trust and respect towards Neville, expressing belief that Neville will do the right thing.
Shrugs off question about life plans, indicating possible detachment or lack of openness.
Pays back money he borrowed from Frank, indicating responsibility and honesty.
Gives Dexter $50,000 without hesitation, showing generosity and trust.
Keeps packed bags and prepares to leave without complaint, suggesting resolve but emotional distance.
Borrowed money from Frank in a transparent but calculated way, showing awareness of risk and interpersonal dynamics.
Calmly confronts danger and arranges to help Dexter financially, showing confidence and responsibility.
Leaves town with bags packed, indicating decisive action to resolve problems rather than avoidance.
Tells Dexter to do what he likes, showing a tolerant attitude.
Tells Dexter it’s time to get far away from him, indicating emotional distance and possible self-isolation.
Offers to pay all money owed to everyone, showing responsibility and trustworthiness.
Insists on meeting Frank in a risky, potentially dangerous place despite objections, possibly showing stubbornness or disregard for others' concerns.
Stands and faces Mister Lee and his heavies without backing down, keeps his word about gambling and owing money, refuses to go outside with Mister Lee.
Refocuses on the roulette wheel, contemplates all or nothing but shows hesitation and restraint.
Aware of surroundings including Mister Lee, his partner, his heavies, and Frank and Big Ernie; does not act impulsively.
Refuses to go outside when asked by Mister Lee despite pressure.
Engages in negotiation with Mister Lee demonstrating knowledge of the situation and setting boundaries.
Committed to risking all his money at roulette despite danger, showing determination and a willingness to face consequences.
Discards his backpack and places all his cash on the table, unafraid and focused, but without interaction indicating friendliness or sincerity.
Refuses to pay and instead decides to play all his money on roulette, showing commitment and willingness to take a huge risk under pressure.
Confidently negotiates with Mister Lee about placing a very sizeable bet at a high-risk establishment.
Despite the threat to his life, he maintains composure and pushes forward decisively to place his bet, demonstrating courage and a clear plan.
Is momentarily distracted by the crowd and the smell of cash, showing some wavering focus when putting down his money.
Admits to not being a gambler and clarifies he played for others' benefit.
Hands over the car key to Frank without hesitation.
Rejects offer of a ride, choosing to walk alone, and admits having no money.
Responds rudely ('Fuck you') to Frank in a friendly, joking manner.
Places a high-stakes bet on black, wins, and calmly leaves the gambling establishment immediately.
Admits he is not actually a gambler despite winning, showing self-awareness and strategic intent.
Walks away with no money on him and refuses a ride, indicating confidence and control over the situation.
Flips car keys absentmindedly while waiting, potentially showing casual composure but also a slight detachment.
Stops, looks back at Amy's building with a solitary, contemplative demeanor.
Crosses the boulevard and presses the intercom button to enter the building, described as the greatest act of his life.
Pauses and hesitates before crossing the boulevard to the building, showing some uncertainty but then acts.
